intro: Ceropegia currorii, commonly known as the "String of Hearts," is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its trailing stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant produces delicate, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a waxy texture. Ceropegia currorii thrives in well-draining soil and requires bright, indirect light for optimal growth.
